page.title: 08LAND OWNERSHIP
page.content: Most of the land in the Stambridge area is owned by {Rankins Farms}.The land is used mainly for arable crops but there is also a large poultry farm in the area. This comprises of several buildings spread around the area. The sheds behind Stambridge Church produce large numbers of fertilised chicken eggs. These are then transferred to an incubation house behind the Cherry Tree Public House.After hatching they are then sent to rearing stations. Eventually they are killed for the table.This is a regular cycle of production. The area produces a wide range of crops including potatoes,rape seed,peas,wheat and numerous other cereals.
